summary: Invalid API key · Fix external API key

content.text:
Please write a concise, factual summary of this conversation. Output ONLY the summary - no preamble. Claude will see this summary when searching previous conversations for useful memories and information.

Summarize what happened in 2-4 sentences. Be factual and specific. Output in <summary></summary> tags.

Include:
- What was built/changed/discussed (be specific)
- Key technical decisions or approaches
- Problems solved or current state

Exclude:
- Apologies, meta-commentary, or your questions
- Raw logs or debug output
- Generic descriptions - focus on what makes THIS conversation unique

Good:
<summary>Built JWT authentication for React app with refresh tokens and protected routes. Fixed token expiration bug by implementing refresh-during-request logic.</summary>

Bad:
<summary>I apologize. The conversation discussed authentication and various approaches were considered...</summary>

User: hi claude, could you help me setup a basic zshrc with oh-my-zsh @zshrc 

Agent: I'll help you set up a basic zshrc with oh-my-zsh. Let me first check the current state of your zshrc file and then create a clean, basic configuration.

Let me check if the file exists and its actual content:

The file exists but is empty. Let me also check if oh-my-zsh is installed:

Great! Oh-my-zsh is already installed. Now let me update the todo list and create a basic zshrc configuration:

Now, let me create a basic zshrc configuration with oh-my-zsh:

Now let me check if the popular plugins I included are installed, and install them if needed:

Let me install these popular plugins for you:

Perfect! Now let me update the configuration to only include plugins that are definitely available:

## Done

I've created a basic **zshrc** configuration with oh-my-zsh at **`/home/skogix/.dotfiles/zshrc`** that includes:

• **Core oh-my-zsh setup** with the default robbyrussell theme
• **Essential plugins**:
  - `git` - Git aliases and functions
  - `zsh-autosuggestions` - Fish-like autosuggestions (installed)
  - `zsh-syntax-highlighting` - Syntax highlighting for commands (installed)  
  - `colored-man-pages` - Colorized man pages
  - `extract` - Extract various archive types

• **Useful aliases** for git and ls commands
• **History configuration** with 10000 lines and deduplication
• **Advanced tab completion** with case-insensitive matching
• **Directory navigation** improvements (auto-cd, directory stack)

To activate the new configuration, run:
```bash
rcup
source ~/.zshrc
```

The configuration is clean and focused on essential features. You can customize the theme by changing `ZSH_THEME` or add more plugins as needed.

---

User: good now i found out what was wrong. now next up i want to look at the earlier one and see how we move them over: @zshrc-a 

Agent: I'll help you analyze the more comprehensive **zshrc-a** file and migrate its useful features to your new basic zshrc. Let me create a task list for this migration:

Looking at **zshrc-a**, here are the key features worth migrating:

## Key Features from zshrc-a:

**Environment & Paths:**
• **SKOGAI** environment paths (lines 40-41, 150-151)
• External storage paths for npm/pnpm (line 44)
• Development tools paths: cargo, dotnet, opencode, lmstudio (lines 56-60)
• argc-completions setup (lines 126-145)

**Oh-My-Zsh Plugins:**
• More plugins: vi-mode, direnv, virtualenv, pyenv, z, uv, npm, nvm, zsh-navigation-tools

**External Integrations:**
• aichat shell integration (line 66, 133-143)
• zsh-navigation-tools (line 70)
• OpenRouter API key (lines 147-148)

**Useful Aliases:**
• System management (update, cleanup, pacman tools)
• Development tools (lazygit, clipboard, config editing)
• Build tools (make with nproc)

Now let me merge the useful features into your new zshrc:

Let me fix that - the file doesn't have the shebang line. Let me do the edits more carefully:

## Done

I've successfully merged the useful features from **zshrc-a** into your new **`/home/skogix/.dotfiles/zshrc`**. The enhanced configuration now includes:

**Key Additions:**
• **SkogAI environment** variables and paths
• **Extended Oh-My-Zsh plugins**: vi-mode, direnv, virtualenv, pyenv, z, uv, npm, nvm, zsh-navigation-tools
• **Development tool paths**: cargo, dotnet, opencode, lmstudio, pnpm
• **External integrations**: 
  - aichat shell integration with Alt+E keybinding
  - argc-completions for enhanced CLI completions
  - zsh-navigation-tools
• **Arch Linux aliases**: update, cleanup, pacman utilities
• **Productivity aliases**: lazygit, clipboard, config editing shortcuts
• **Build optimizations**: make and ninja with automatic core detection
• **skogcli integration**: Loads environment variables from your config system

The configuration intelligently checks for optional components before loading them, so it won't break if something is missing. It also preserves the ability to load local overrides via `~/.zshrc.local`.

To activate:
```bash
rcup
source ~/.zshrc
```

---

User: now what did you choose to not include?

Agent: Looking at **zshrc-a**, here's what I deliberately **didn't include** and why:

## Excluded Features:

**1. Duplicate/Redundant Configuration:**
• **SKOGAI paths defined twice** (lines 2, 40-41, 150-151) - kept only one definition
• **SSH agent plugin** - commented out in original, likely using system ssh-agent

**2. Experimental/Commented Code:**
• **zplug plugin manager** (lines 162-246) - Large commented block, seems you moved away from it
• **Extensive completion customizations** (lines 227-244) - Commented out, redundant with Oh-My-Zsh

**3. Specific Tool Commands:**
• **`alias commit='aider --commit...'`** - Very specific aider command with hardcoded model
• **`alias gemini-cli="npx @google/gemini-cli"`** - Project-specific
• **`alias qwen='node /mnt/extra/...'`** - Hardcoded path to specific project
• **`alias fzf-pacman=...`** - Complex fzf command, might not have fzf installed

**4. Potentially Missing Dependencies:**
• **`source /usr/share/nvm/init-nvm.sh`** - System-specific nvm path
• **tailscale plugin** - Requires tailscale to be installed
• **ansible plugin** - Requires ansible

**5. Terminal Appearance:**
• **`LESS_TERMCAP_*` exports** (lines 116-117) - Terminal color codes for less pager
• **`ZSH_THEME="simple"`** - Kept robbyrussell as it's more feature-rich

**6. Security/Privacy:**
• **Direct sourcing of openrouter key** without the export (line 148)
• Left it as optional loading but didn't force the export

These exclusions keep the configuration cleaner and more portable. Most can be added to `~/.zshrc.local` if you need them for specific environments.

---

User: now please add those back as commented out with a [TODO] tag and i go through them

Agent: ## Done

I've added all the excluded features back as commented sections with `[TODO]` tags in **`/home/skogix/.dotfiles/zshrc`**. The additions include:

**Plugin TODOs:**
• `ssh-agent`, `tailscale`, `ansible`, `themes` - Additional Oh-My-Zsh plugins

**Environment TODOs:**
• Terminal color codes for less pager
• OpenRouter API key export
• System-specific NVM initialization

**Alias TODOs:**
• `commit` - aider integration with specific model
• `gemini-cli` - Google Gemini CLI wrapper
• `qwen` - Qwen code assistant
• `fzf-pacman` - Interactive package search with fzf

**Major Sections TODOs:**
• **Zplug plugin manager** - Complete alternative/addition to Oh-My-Zsh (lines ~182-227)
• **Advanced completion settings** - Fine-tuned completion behavior (lines ~229-252)

Each TODO is clearly marked and commented out, so you can review and uncomment the ones you want to enable. The configuration remains functional with all TODOs commented.

---

User: how did you choose to install the extra plugins/

Agent: Looking at how I installed the plugins earlier, I used **git clone** to install them directly into the Oh-My-Zsh custom plugins directory:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions
git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting
```

This is the **standard Oh-My-Zsh method** for third-party plugins - they go in `~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/`.

However, I notice you've now **enabled ssh-agent** (line 39), but the other plugins I added to the config are a mix of:

**Built-in Oh-My-Zsh plugins** (already installed):
• `git`, `colored-man-pages`, `extract`, `vi-mode`, `direnv`, `virtualenv`, `pyenv`, `z`, `npm`, `nvm`, `ssh-agent`

**Custom/third-party plugins** (need installation):
• `zsh-autosuggestions` ✓ (already installed)
• `zsh-syntax-highlighting` ✓ (already installed) 
• `zsh-navigation-tools` - This one might need special handling
• `uv` - Might not exist as an official plugin

The plugins like `tailscale` and `ansible` that are commented out would just need to be uncommented - they're built into Oh-My-Zsh and don't require separate installation.

**Alternative approaches** I didn't use but you have in comments:
• **zplug** - Plugin manager that can handle GitHub repos, binaries, Oh-My-Zsh plugins all in one place
• **Manual fpath** - Adding completion directories directly to fpath

Would you like me to check which of the enabled plugins actually exist and work?
Invalid API key · Fix external API key
